intro: Trymalium, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are typically alternate and have a velvety texture, while the stems are often hairy. Trymalium species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and unique flower shapes. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
